segments.source_content:
---
slug: /171
title: "This Week In React #171: Expo, React Conf, React 19 preview, Next.js, React-Email, Storybook, Panda, Nexar, React-Query, TypeScript, Vocs, Skottie, Harmony, VisionOS..."
authors: [slorber, bndkt]
date: 01-24-2024
---
Hi everyone!

This week the official React conf has been announced. Co-hosted with Callstack, I hope for React Native to be well-covered! React 19 is coming, and we continue to get sneak peeks into upcoming features such as proper Web Components support. I wouldn't be surprised to see it being released during the conf alongside React Forget ü§û.

translations.fr: Cette semaine, la conf√©rence officielle React a √©t√© annonc√©e. Co-organis√©e avec Callstack, j'esp√®re une bonne couverture de React Native ! React 19 arrive, et nous continuons d'entrevoir les fonctionnalit√©s √† venir comme le support des Web Components. Je ne serais pas surpris de le voir publi√© pendant la conf√©rence aux c√¥t√©s de React Forget ü§û.
translations.en: Cette semaine, la conf√©rence React officielle a √©t√© annonc√©e. Co-organis√©e avec Callstack, j'esp√®re que React Native sera bien couvert ! React 19 arrive, et nous continuons d'entrevoir des fonctionnalit√©s √† venir comme le support appropri√© des Web Components. Je ne serais pas surpris de le voir sortir pendant la conf√©rence aux c√¥t√©s de React Forget ü§û.

segments.source_content: In other news, this week is full of interesting articles and releases, including Next.js, React-Emails...

translations.fr: Autre actualit√© : cette semaine regorge d'articles et de versions int√©ressants, incluant Next.js, React-Emails...
translations.en: Par ailleurs, cette semaine est riche en articles et sorties int√©ressants, notamment sur Next.js, React-Emails...

segments.source_content: The React Native world has woken up with an impressive Expo SDK 50 release, and Expo Router v3 becoming the very first universal full-stack React framework.

translations.fr: L'√©cosyst√®me React Native s'est r√©veill√© avec une impressionnante version d'Expo SDK 50, et Expo Router v3 devient le tout premier framework React full-stack universel.
translations.en: L'√©cosyst√®me React Native s'est r√©veill√© avec une sortie impressionnante d'Expo SDK 50, et Expo Router v3 devient le tout premier framework React full-stack universel.

segments.source_content: üò¥ Sleep peacefully knowing that Axiom‚Äôs zero-config observability for Vercel projects has you covered.

translations.en: üò¥ Dormez sur vos deux oreilles gr√¢ce √† l'observabilit√© zero-config d'Axiom pour vos projets Vercel.

segments.source_content:
- Use Axiom's pre-built dashboard for an overview across all your Vercel logs and vitals, drill down to specific projects and deployments, and get insight on how functions are performing with a single click.
- [next-axiom](https://github.com/axiomhq/next-axiom) allows you to send logs and events from any part of your Next.js projects - client, edge, or server-side - without any special configuration.
- Easily send structured logs directly from your code and analyze them together with Vercel logs.

translations.fr:
- Utilisez le tableau de bord pr√©construit d'Axiom pour une vue d'ensemble de tous vos logs et m√©triques Vercel, explorez des projets et d√©ploiements sp√©cifiques, et obtenez des insights sur les performances des fonctions en un clic.
- [next-axiom](https://github.com/axiomhq/next-axiom) permet d'envoyer logs et √©v√©nements depuis n'importe quelle partie de vos projets Next.js - c√¥t√© client, edge ou serveur - sans configuration sp√©ciale.
- Envoyez facilement des logs structur√©s depuis votre code et analysez-les avec vos logs Vercel.
translations.en:
- Utilisez le tableau de bord pr√©construit d'Axiom pour une vue d'ensemble de tous vos logs et vitaux Vercel, explorez des projets et d√©ploiements sp√©cifiques, et obtenez des insights sur les performances des fonctions en un clic.
- [next-axiom](https://github.com/axiomhq/next-axiom) vous permet d'envoyer des logs et √©v√©nements depuis n'importe quelle partie de vos projets Next.js - c√¥t√© client, edge ou serveur - sans configuration sp√©ciale.
- Envoyez facilement des logs structur√©s directement depuis votre code et analysez-les avec vos logs Vercel.

segments.source_content: Axiom efficiently captures 100% of your event data so you‚Äôll never have to worry about sampling or retention, and you‚Äôll never have to guess what your users are experiencing.

translations.fr: Axiom capture efficacement 100% de vos donn√©es √©v√©nementielles : plus de soucis d'√©chantillonnage ou de r√©tention, et plus besoin de deviner ce que vivent vos utilisateurs.
translations.en: Axiom capture efficacement 100% de vos donn√©es √©v√©nementielles, vous n'aurez donc jamais √† vous soucier de l'√©chantillonnage ou de la r√©tention, et vous ne devinerez plus jamais ce que vivent vos utilisateurs.

segments.source_content: ## ‚öõÔ∏è React {#react}
[![Next.js App Router Training](/emails/issues/171/appRouterTraining.jpg)](https://nextjs-app-router-training.vercel.app/)
**[Next.js App Router Training](https://nextjs-app-router-training.vercel.app/)**

A playground with a quite exhaustive list of interactive demos about Next.js features. This is a great resource to understand how the Next.js App Router behaves by actually seeing it running with a convenient way to browse the related code.

translations.fr: Un terrain de jeu avec une liste exhaustive de d√©mos interactives sur les fonctionnalit√©s Next.js. Excellente ressource pour comprendre le comportement du Next.js App Router en le voyant fonctionner, avec un moyen pratique d'explorer le code associ√©.
translations.en: Un bac √† sable avec une liste assez exhaustive de d√©mos interactives sur les fonctionnalit√©s de Next.js. Une ressource exceptionnelle pour comprendre le comportement du routeur d'application Next.js en le voyant fonctionner, avec un moyen pratique d'explorer le code associ√©.

segments.source_content:
- üí∏ [Accelerate your workflow with MightyMeld, a visual dev tool for React codebases. Drag, drop, click, and prompt your UI into place while you hand-code the rest of it.](https://www.mightymeld.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact4&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=1&utm_content=top)
- üìÖ [React Conf 2024:](https://conf.react.dev/) the official conf is back May 15-16 in Henderson (Nevada/USA), in collaboration with Callstack.
- üëÄ [React core - Web Components / custom element support is ready for React 19](https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/11347#issuecomment-1899140345)
- üëÄ [Nexar: application architecture for Next.js App Router apps](https://nexar.dev/): An opinionated set of patterns and conventions to build scalable Next.js apps, including a full open-source application.
- üê¶ [React-Forget is written in TypeScript/Babel. It will eventually be rewritten in Rust later, or compiled to native with Static Hermes!](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov2/status/1747640983980806466) üôâ
- üìú [New client-side hooks coming to React 19](https://marmelab.com/blog/2024/01/23/react-19-new-hooks.html): Overview of new React hooks and APIs coming in the next major that you will be able to use without a framework.
- üìú [The Query Options API](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/the-query-options-api): Dominik explains the advantages of removing React-Query overloads in v5, and using a single unified options object that you can reuse across all React-Query APIs thanks to TypeScript duck typing. The usage of a fancy TypeScript DataTag technique greatly improves the DX üôâ.
- üìú [Panda v1 Roadmap](https://www.adebayosegun.com/blog/panda-v1-roadmap): the CSS-in-JS lib is progressing toward a v1 release. It has already optimized its runtime and integrated Lightning CSS. Remaining tasks include Panda Studio (to vizualize design tokens), opacity modifiers, container queries, config validation‚Ä¶
- üìú [Wrangling Tuple Types](https://kyleshevlin.com/wrangling-tuple-types/): Explains why you might want to use TypeScript ‚Äúas const‚Äù while returning tuples from custom React hooks.
- üìú [Build a Next.js app in Storybook with React Server Components and Mock Service Worker](https://storybook.js.org/blog/build-a-nextjs-app-with-rsc-msw-storybook/): The RSC support coming with Storybook 8 permits to develop a full Next.js app in isolation.
- üìú [Build an app with Remix and Bun](https://sergiodxa.com/tutorials/build-an-app-with-remix-and-bun): It‚Äôs possible to use Bun at runtime, but for now you have to keep building the Remix app with Node.
- üìú [Harmony - A new kind of color picker for React](https://polar.sh/emilwidlund/posts/a-new-kind-of-color-picker-with-react-typescript): New fancy React color picker package, that matches multiple colors together according to harmonies.
- üìú [RSC is React Server + Component](https://bobaekang.com/blog/rsc-is-react-server-plus-component/): Gives you an interesting mental model to understand RSCs.
- üìú [From Next.js to Rails then Elixir: My journey through React.js burnout](https://dev.to/danielbergholz/from-nextjs-to-rails-then-elixir-my-journey-through-reactjs-burnout-h8d)
- üìú [Detailed React. Reconciliation, Renderers, Fiber, Virtual Tree](https://blog.frontend-almanac.com/JqtGelofzm1)
- üìú [Shining a light on Caustics with Shaders and React Three Fiber](https://blog.maximeheckel.com/posts/caustics-in-webgl/)
- üìú [Mastering React and OpenLayers Integration: A Comprehensive Guide](https://mxd.codes/articles/how-to-create-a-web-map-with-open-layers-and-react)
- üìú [Optimizing images for Next.js sites with imgproxy and docker](https://mxd.codes/articles/optimizing-images-for-next-js-sites-with-imgproxy-and-docker)
- üì¶ [dream-css-tool - styled-components, but without a client runtime. Built for Next.js](https://github.com/joshwcomeau/dream-css-tool): Josh Comeau explores creating his own CSS-in-JS lb.
- üì¶ [React Email 2.0 - New preview experience, improved performance, CodeBlock component](https://resend.com/blog/react-email-2)‚Ä¶
- üì¶ [Next.js 14.1 - Improving DX, Turbopack, self-hosting, history APIs, image component, parallel and intercepted routes‚Ä¶](https://nextjs.org/blog/next-14-1)
- üì¶ [Zustand 4.5 - getInitialState to prevent hydration mismatches](https://github.com/pmndrs/zustand/releases/tag/v4.5.0)
- üì¶ [Relay 16.2 - @preloadable directive](https://github.com/facebook/relay/releases/tag/v16.2.0)
- üì¶ [Astro 4.2 - Prerendering using Speculation Rules API, customizable image optimization](https://astro.build/blog/astro-420/)‚Ä¶
- üì¶ [vocs - Minimal Documentation Framework, powered by React + Vite](https://github.com/wevm/vocs)
- üì¶ [ReScript 11.0 - React lazy components](https://rescript-lang.org/blog/release-11-0-0)

segments.source_content: ## üì± React-Native {#react-native}
This week‚Äôs React Native news is compiled by Benedikt. Feedback, suggestions or news to share? Let me know on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bndkt).

translations.fr: Les actualit√©s React Native de cette semaine sont compil√©es par Benedikt. Commentaires, suggestions ou nouvelles √† partager ? Contactez-moi sur [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bndkt).
translations.en: Les actualit√©s React Native de cette semaine sont compil√©es par Benedikt. Commentaires, suggestions ou actualit√©s √† partager ? Contactez-moi sur [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bndkt).

segments.source_content: [![Expo SDK 50](/emails/issues/171/expo50.jpg)](https://expo.dev/changelog/2024/01-18-sdk-50k)
**[Expo SDK 50](https://expo.dev/changelog/2024/01-18-sdk-50)**

Expo SDK 50 introduces Expo Dev Tools Plugins, comes with new SQLite and Camera APIs, and adds `@expo/fingerprint`, a new way to determine whether an updated JS bundle update is compatible with a given native build. This release also marks the [end of Webpack support](https://blog.expo.dev/webpack-support-in-expo-cli-is-now-deprecated-e9831d7eb631) in Expo, which is now deprecated in favor of Metro. The best and most convenient way to get up to speed on Expo 50 is probably to watch Simon rattle through it in about 15 minutes on [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=shaGaiwu4Fg).

translations.fr: Expo SDK 50 introduit les plugins Expo Dev Tools, propose de nouvelles API SQLite et Camera, et ajoute `@expo/fingerprint`, une nouvelle m√©thode pour d√©terminer si une mise √† jour du bundle JS est compatible avec une build native donn√©e. Cette version marque √©galement la [fin du support Webpack](https://blog.expo.dev/webpack-support-in-expo-cli-is-now-deprecated-e9831d7eb631) dans Expo, d√©sormais d√©pr√©ci√© au profit de Metro. La mani√®re la plus pratique de se familiariser avec Expo 50 est probablement de regarder Simon en faire le tour en 15 minutes sur [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=shaGaiwu4Fg).
translations.en: Expo SDK 50 introduit les plugins Expo Dev Tools, propose de nouvelles API SQLite et Camera, et ajoute `@expo/fingerprint`, une nouvelle m√©thode pour d√©terminer si une mise √† jour du bundle JS est compatible avec une build native donn√©e. Cette version marque √©galement la [fin du support Webpack](https://blog.expo.dev/webpack-support-in-expo-cli-is-now-deprecated-e9831d7eb631) dans Expo, d√©sormais d√©pr√©ci√© au profit de Metro. Le moyen le plus pratique de se familiariser avec Expo 50 est probablement de regarder Simon le parcourir en 15 minutes sur [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=shaGaiwu4Fg).

segments.source_content: [![Expo Router v3](/emails/issues/171/router3.jpg)](https://expo.dev/changelog/2024/01-23-router-3)
**[Expo Router v3](https://expo.dev/changelog/2024/01-23-router-3)**

Along with Expo SDK 50, Expo Router v3 has been released. It brings lots of performance and stability improvements and comes with better docs. Most notably, there is now experimental support for building universal server endpoints with API Routes. Expo Router is now the very first universal, full-stack React framework!

translations.fr: Parall√®lement √† Expo SDK 50, Expo Router v3 a √©t√© publi√©. Il apporte de nombreuses am√©liorations de performances et de stabilit√© ainsi qu'une meilleure documentation. Plus notablement, il inclut d√©sormais un support exp√©rimental pour cr√©er des points de terminaison serveur universels avec les API Routes. Expo Router devient ainsi le tout premier framework React universel full-stack !
translations.en: Parall√®lement √† Expo SDK 50, Expo Router v3 a √©t√© publi√©. Il apporte d'importantes am√©liorations de performance et stabilit√© ainsi qu'une meilleure documentation. On note notamment le support exp√©rimental pour cr√©er des endpoints serveur universels avec API Routes. Expo Router devient ainsi le tout premier framework React full-stack universel !
